body_content.explanation: an occasion when a piece of film or an image showing a different subject or person is shown during a film, television programme, etc.:
examples: There are occasional cutaways to the interviewer smiling or nodding.
The film has a documentary look, with unsteady camera shots and quick cutaways.

body_content.explanation: a picture of something with some outer parts not included so that you can see the inside:
examples: The sketch shows a cutaway of a Georgian house.
To explain how the mechanism works, we really need a cutaway.

body_content.explanation: part of a picture or piece of material that has been cut away to form a hole:
examples: The report is in a card folder with a cutaway so you can see the title page.

body_content.explanation: a guitar that is designed with a space at the top of its body on one side of the neck (= long narrow part), or the space itself:
examples: She usually plays an electro-acoustic cutaway.
Guitars without a cutaway tend to have a fuller sound.

body_content.explanation: a coat or jacket that is short at the front and long at the back, usually worn for formal occasions:
examples: I love the velvet blazers and cutaways.
The groom wore a cutaway with a bright red pocket handkerchief.

body_content.explanation: (of an image or short piece of film) shown during a film, television programme, etc. and having a different subject to the main subject:
examples: There will be no cutaway shots of a candidate while his or her opponent is speaking.

body_content.explanation: (of a picture or model) with some outer parts not included so that you can see the inside:
examples: The cutaway diagram shows the virus with its protein spikes on the outer layer, an intermediate layer and the inner layer containing RNA.
There was a cutaway picture showing the inside of the reactor.

body_content.explanation: (of a coat or jacket) short at the front and long at the back, and usually worn for formal occasions :
examples: He wears a formal black cutaway coat and trousers.

body_content.explanation: a piece of clothing designed with parts cut out of it so that it has holes or is shorter than you would expect:
examples: One popular version of the cutaway swimsuit is the one-strap.
I like the black velvet dress with cutaway shoulders.

body_content.explanation: A cutaway guitar is designed with a space at the top of its body on one side of the neck (= long narrow part):
examples: There are advantages and disadvantages to a cutaway guitar.
